page.title: 05STORNOWAY SOUTH - ENERGY
page.content: {Stornoway Power}Station supplies electricity for 1400 households in Lewis and Harris.The station produces 1100kv which is converted to 3300kv. Every 2 weeks a tanker from Grangemouth delivers the hydro carbon fuel. {PEAT}The Stornoway Trust supplies 310 peat banks. The peat is cut with a tarashker. Peat will still be a fuel in the future since it is plentiful and inexpensive. {GAS}is only piped to people in the town itself. Scottish Gas supplies 1100 people in Stornoway. Scottish Gas was the first public service in Britain to supply gas. {COAL}is supplied to many people on the island who each use an average of 2 bags a week. Coal has been supplied up here for a very long time ,each year 5000 tonnes of coal is used.
